alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 14 at 11:52PM CDT until August 15 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Johnson County in east Tennessee... East central Carter County in east Tennessee... * Until 130 AM EDT. * At 1251 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles northwest of Beech Mountain, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Johnson and east central Carter Counties, including the following locations... Elk Mills. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
